review.title: A theoretical contribution to the fast implementation of null linear discriminant analysis method using random matrix multiplication with scatter matrices
review.abstract: The null linear discriminant analysis method is a competitive approach for dimensionality reduction. The implementation of this method, however, is computationally expensive. Recently, a fast implementation of null linear discriminant analysis method using random matrix multiplication with scatter matrices was proposed. However, if the random matrix is chosen arbitrarily, the orientation matrix may be rank deficient, and some useful discriminant information will be lost. In this paper, we investigate how to choose the random matrix properly, such that the two criteria of the null LDA method are satisfied theoretically. We give a necessary and sufficient condition to guarantee full column rank of the orientation matrix. Moreover, the geometric characterization of the condition is also described.

sections.text: ar Xiv: 140 9.25 79v1 [cs.NA] 9 September 201 4The linear zero discrimination analysis method is a competitive approach to reducing dimensionality, but implementing this method is mathematically expensive. Recently, a rapid implementation of the linear zero discrimination analysis method using random matrix multiplication with scatter matrices has been proposed. However, if the random matrix is chosen arbitrarily, the orientation matrix may be insufficient and some useful discriminatory information may be lost. In this paper, we will examine how to correctly select the random matrix so that the two criteria of the zero LDA method are theoretically fulfilled. We specify a necessary and sufficient condition to guarantee the full column rank of the orientation matrix. In addition, the geometric characterization of the condition is described. Keywords: reduction of dimensional lineality, random number analysis (DA), discrimination size (zero).
